episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and historical facts, including a king's fear on a train, an ice hockey player's unusual allergy, the aftermath of a major music festival, and a unique wartime bookshop strategy.

facts.fact: The King Ferdinand of Bulgaria was so scared of being murdered on the Oriental Express that he locked himself in the toilet.
The new goalie of the ice hockey team, the Belfast Giants, is allergic to ice.
After every festival, the founder of Glastonbury has to drive around his farm with a giant magnet.
During World War II, the owners of Foils bookshop protected the store from Nazi bombs by covering the roof in copies of Mein Kampf.
